alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Gwinnett; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Forsyth, northwestern Gwinnett and northeastern Fulton Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 759 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Suwanee, or 8 miles northwest of Lawrenceville, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lawrenceville, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Duluth, Sugar Hill, Suwanee, Buford, Berkeley Lake and Brookwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
